pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:0.5: 66. The second training rule on married girls
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.2: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to married girls who were more than twelve years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.3: They were ignorant and incompetent, and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.4: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.5: “How can nuns give the full admission to married girls who are more than twelve years old, but who haven’t trained for two years in the six rules?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.6: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.10: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.11: and after criticizing them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.12: “Monks, approval is required for a married girl who is more than twelve years old to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.13: And the approval is to be given like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.14: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that married girl who is more than twelve years old should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.15: ‘Venerables, I, so-and-so, a married girl who is more than twelve years old, am training under Venerable so-and-so. I ask the Sangha for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.16: And she should ask a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.18: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.19: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.20: The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.21: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.23: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.24: The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.25: The Sangha gives approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.26: Any nun who approves of giving approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.27: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.28: The Sangha has given approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.29: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.30: That married girl, who is more than twelve years old, should be told to say this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.31: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.32: I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.33: Then, after criticizing those nuns in many ways for being difficult to support …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.34: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:1.35.1: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old, but who has not trained in the six rules for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.5: Who is more than twelve years old:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.6: who has reached twelve years of age.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.8: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.12: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.15: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastic boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.16: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.17: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.18: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.19: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.20.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.21: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.22: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.23: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.24: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.25: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.27: if she gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained in the six rules for two years;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.29: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.30: The sixth training rule is finished.
